title-part.text: INDEXING SCHEME ASSOCIATED WITH SUBCLASS C10M RELATING TO LUBRICATING COMPOSITIONS
Metal present as such or in compounds

note.note-paragraph: In this group, metals should be indexed according to their group of the Periodic Table.

title-part.text: Specified physical properties of component of lubricating compositions
Particles of special shape or size
Specified physical or chemical property which is improved by the additive characterising the lubricating composition, e.g. multifunctional additives
Inhibition of corrosion, e.g. anti-rust agents, anti-corrosives
Specified use or application for which the lubricating composition is intended
Instruments or other precision apparatus, e.g. damping fluids
in connection with recordings on magnetic tape or disc

CPC-specific-text.text: Oil for deformation operations, e.g. drawing, rolling

title-part.text: Form in which the lubricant is applied to the material being lubricated
dissolved or suspended in a carrier which subsequently evaporates to leave a lubricant coating
Gaseous phase, at least during working conditions
Chemical after-treatment of the constituents of the lubricating composition

CPC-specific-text.text: by organic hydroxy group containing compounds

title-part.text: by sulfur or a compound containing sulfur
by phosphorus or a compound containing phosphorus, e.g. PxSy
by boron or a compound containing boron
Special pretreatment of the material to be lubricated, e.g. phosphatising or chromatising of a metal
Nature of the metal present as such or in compounds, i.e. in salts

note.note-paragraph: Indexing codes C10N2210/01 to C10N2210/08 are only to be used as linked codes in combination with codes chosen from subclass M10M identifying the chemical nature of the compounds concerned:Example: C10M2201/084+C10N2210/02

title-part.text: Group I, e.g. Li, Na, K, Cs, Cu, Ag, Au
Group II, e.g. Mg, Ca, Ba, Zn, Cd, Hg
Group III, e.g. Al, In, La
Group IV, e.g. Sn, Pb, Ti, Zr
Group V, e.g. V, As, Sb, Bi
Group VI, e.g. Cr, Mo, W
Specified physical or chemical properties or characteristics, i.e. function, of single compounds in lubricating compositions

note.note-paragraph: Indexing codes C10N2220/301 to C10N2220/306 are only used in association with group C10M171/008 to provide information about the specific refrigerant.

title-part.text: Specified physical or chemical properties of lubricating compositions
Detergent properties, e.g. for cleaning, inhibition or removing varnish
Dispersion properties, e.g. for dispersing solids, carbon residues, sludge
Catalyst protection, e.g. in exhaust gas converters
Low content or no content compositions
Chlorine free or low chlorine content compositions
Phosphor free or low phosphor content compositions
Sulfur free or low sulfur content compositions
Boron free or low contentn boron compositions
Boundary lubrication or thin film lubrication
Elastohydrodynamic lubrication, e.g. for high compressibility layers
Reduction of noise, shudder or vibrations
Specified uses or applications of lubricating compositions
Hydraulic fluids, e.g. for brakes, clutches
with removal of material, e.g. cutting, grinding, drilling
without removal of material, e.g. forming, gorging, drawing, pressing, stamping, rolling, extruding
Generators or electric motors in oil or gas winning field
Form or state of lubricant compositions in which they are used
compositions providing a coating after evaportion of a medium, e.g. of solvent, water
in the form of films or sheets
Composite materials, or sliding materials in which lubricants are integrally moulded
Chemical after-treatment or modifications of compounds
Treatment with epoxides or oxyalkylation reactions
Treatment with sulfur or sulfur-containing compounds
Treatment with phosphorus or phospohorus-containing compounds
Treatment with boron or boron-containing compounds
Specific manufacturing methods for lubricant compositions or compounds not covered by groups C10N2210/00 to M10M260/00
Specific pretreatment of the surface to be lubricated, e.g. phosphatising
